title: Babysitter jailed for shaking, kicking, and smothering baby twins
text:
McKenna Newell was sentenced to 30 days in jail for child abuse (Picture: Salt Lake County Jail/Fox 61)

A babysitter is behind bars after she was caught on film kicking, shaking, and smothering two five-month-old twins in her care, police say.

McKenna Newell, 21, was sentenced to served 30 days in prison and 36 months on probation this week after she pleaded guilty to one count of child abuse in Salt Lake City, Utah.

Newell turned herself into police in January after a warrant was issued for her arrest, according to West Jordan Police Sergeant JC Holt who spoke of the abuse caught on a nanny cam.

Holt said: ‘It’s our worst fear as a parent that something like that would happen to your child, especially with somebody you know that you’ve left that child in their care.’

According to a probable cause statement, Newell shook the children, then ‘used her hand to hit (one of the children) on her legs…(she) also kicked (the child) in the rib/leg area several times.’

Newell must report to the Salt Lake County Jail by October 11 to complete her 30 day sentence. (Picture: Google Maps)

The statement continues to say: ‘(Newell) is seen in the video covering their nose and mouth area with her hand.’

Newell had a profile on a widely used caregiver website, Care.com, according to Fox61.

Care.com later released a statement saying: ‘This incident is deeply disturbing to us and our thoughts are with the family.

‘The individual in question did have a profile on Care.com which has now been closed.’

Judge Douglas Hogan sentenced Newell to a prison term ‘not to exceed’ five years, but ordered the sentence suspended.

That means jail time is contingent on whether Newell completes the other parts of her sentence.

She was also ordered to pay a $5,000 fine and will have to complete 500 hours of community service.

Holt said: ‘(Newell) lost her patience. She didn’t deal with it in a healthy manner. I think that all of us as adults, we can be susceptible to that at times. It’s not excusable and it’s not okay, that’s why we handled the case the way that we did.’
description: McKenna Newell was sentenced to 30 days in jail for child abuse in Utah.
